relation: Clears VRF and interface-related information for RIP such as database entries and statistics.
Clears the out-of-memory state for RIP.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS XR Routing Command Reference for the Cisco CRS Router, Release 4.3.x - RIP Commands [Cisco Carrier Routing System] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {227408=The destination route 50.50.0.0/24 is learned through RIP, and the source 10.0.0.20 advertised it from GigabitEthernet 0/6/0/0. The route was last updated one second ago., 240258=12.0.0.13, 227765=[1] via 10.0.0.20, next hop 10.0.0.20, Uptime: 1s, GigabitEthernet0/6/0/0, 227224=[1] via 10.0.0.20, next-hop 10.0.0.20, Uptime: 1s, GigabitEthernet0/6/0/0}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description { md5 | text } mode keychain_name keychain authentication no { md5 | text } mode keychain_name keychain authentication To enable an authentication keychain mechanism on RIP interfaces, use the authentication keychain mode command in interface configuration mode or VRF-interface configuration mode. To disable authentication keychain configuration on RIP interfaces, use the no form of this command. authentication keychain mode (RIP) vrf (RIP) validate-update-source disable timers basic split-horizon disable (RIP) site-of-origin (RIP) show rip statistics show rip interface show rip database show rip show protocols (RIP) send version route-policy (RIP) router rip redistribute (RIP) receive version poison-reverse passive-interface (RIP) output-delay nsf (RIP) neighbor (RIP) metric-zero-accept maximum-paths (RIP) interface (RIP) distance (RIP) default-metric (RIP) default-information originate (RIP) clear rip statistics clear rip out-of-memory clear rip interface clear rip database clear rip broadcast-for-v2 auto-summary
textAfterTable: md5 Specifies that the authentication keychain mode is keyed message digest (md5). text Specifies that the authentication keychain mode is clear text. Command Default Keychain authentication is disabled. Command Modes Interface configuration VRF-interface configuration Command History Release Modification Release 4.0.0 This command was introduced. Usage Guidelines All keychains need to be configured in Cisco IOS XR keychain database using the keychain configuration commands described in Implementing Keychain Management module of Cisco IOS XR System Security Configuration Guide for the Cisco CRS Router Task ID Task ID Operation rip read, write
